info.description: API to retrieve the pricing benefit details for activity charge, periodic charge or interest rates for enterprise product pricing arrangement or package
info.title: Enterprise product pricing

get.summary: Retrieves the package pricing benefit details
get.description: Retrieves the package pricing benefit details for the package arrangement and the linked contracts or accounts within a specific period. The period start date and end date should be provided to fetch the total package pricing benefits applied for the linked arrangements

parameters.name: packageId
parameters.description: Indicates the arrangement reference of the package

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Indicates the date till which the transaction history requested. If 20120101 is the start date and 20120201 is the end date, all transactions that are booked between January 1 to February 1 2012 are returned

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

get.summary: Retrieves the fee amount applicable for any activity charge event of an account
get.description: Retrieves a non-binding quote(online quotation) with fee and benefit details for an arrangement when activity is triggered. E.g To fetch fees and cashback details applicable for a new account creation, the user must input the event 'NewAccount' as one of the query parameters in the API. This will return the charge and cashback details along with any benefits if applicable

parameters.name: baseContractReference
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the contract or account in which the event is raised in the core system. This would typically be a unique reference to identify the specific contract or account in the system

parameters.name: systemReference
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the system in which the event originated from. For ex, ‘Hogan’ or ‘TransactAccounts’ etc

parameters.name: companyReference
parameters.description: Contains the identifier of the underlying Entity or Company or Branch

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Indicates the name of the event that is understood by the Enterprise product pricing system.

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Contains the channel in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on channel, then this is not significant

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Contains the branch name/code in which the business activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on branch, then this is not significant

parameters.name: lineOfBusiness
parameters.description: Contains the line of business in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on line of business, then this is not significant

parameters.name: skipPricing
parameters.description: Flag to indicate if the product pricing benefit needs to be skipped or not.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from Transact on every enquiry request

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: Identifier of the lead company of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch for the respective contract for customer data protection purposes. Example US0010001.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Identifies the device type

parameters.name: userRole
parameters.description: User who initiated the transaction

parameters.name: disablePagination
parameters.description: Indicates the pagination header attributes availability. If set to 'true', it fetches all the data

get.summary: Retrieves the interest rates for the given product
get.description: Retrieves the interest rates with benefits applied for the given product. For example, the user wants to know the benefit applied for different interest conditions such as credit interest, debit interest available in the product, and interest rates along with all the benefits is returned

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

parameters.name: partyId
parameters.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

parameters.name: effectiveDate
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

parameters.name: rateName
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the underlying interest rate component(s). Eg: Credit interest, Debit Interest, Penalty Interest etc

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: This is the payment amount

parameters.name: tenor
parameters.description: Contains the term of the deposits or loans contract

get.summary: Retrieves the fee amount applicable for any business transaction of an account
get.description: Retrieves a non-binding quote(online quotation) with fee and benefit details for an arrangement when a transaction  is triggered. For example: to fetch the fee or cashback details applicable for an ATM withdrawal, the user must input the event 'ATMWithdrawal' as one of the query parameters. The user must send the transaction amount and currency as part of the API,  and the system will immediately fetch the applicable charges or cashback details along with any other benefit if applicable.

parameters.name: baseContractReference
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the contract or account in which the event is raised in the core system. This would typically be a unique reference to identify the specific contract or account in the core system.

parameters.name: systemReference
parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the system in which the event originated from. For ex, ‘Hogan’ or ‘TransactAccounts’ etc

parameters.description: Indicates the name of the event that is understood by the Enterprise product pricing system.

parameters.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Contains the channel in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on channel, then this is not significant

parameters.name: branch
parameters.description: Contains the branch name/code in which the business activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on branch, then this is not significant

parameters.name: lineOfBusiness
parameters.description: Contains the line of business in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on line of business, then this is not significant

parameters.name: transactionCurrency
parameters.description: Indicates the currency of the transaction. For example GBP, USD etc.

parameters.name: transactionAmount
parameters.description: Contains the transaction amount. This is based on the currency, either local or foreign currency

parameters.name: contractAmount
parameters.description: Contains the amount of the deposits or loans contract

parameters.name: contextName
parameters.description: Indicates specific context that needs to be passed in addition to the amount/currency to indicate more details. This context should influence the pricing.

parameters.name: contextValue
parameters.description: Indicates the value passed for the context name.

get.summary: Retrieves the pricing details of a simulated quotation by providing a user defined quotation reference or system generated quotation reference
get.description: Retrieves the simulated pricing details for the simulation done earlier by providing the quotation reference number generated from the POST API. Adjust API allows manual adjustments to the pricing. As part of the GET simulation API along with the quotation reference number will provide the details of base pricing along with adjusted pricing as well. If no adjustments were done, the system will generate the simulated pricing only

get.summary: Retrieves the manual pricing adjustment details for an arrangement
get.description: This function allows the user to obtain the details of any manual price adjustments made in an arrangement. The system provides information such as the date of expiry, the type of adjustment made (including adjustments from a base amount, waivers, overrides, etc.), and the adjustment amount. This feature helps users to keep track of any pricing negotiations that have taken place

packagePricing.description: Contains the pricing details of package such as base value, adjust value, net value. It may also include arrangement id, product line and benefits

date.description: Indicates the date on which activity was performed

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

productLine.description: The top level product line, which the product is ultimately attached to. May be a Temenos-defined product line such as ACCOUNTS, AGENT, BUNDLE, CONSENT, DEPOSITS, LENDING, REWARDS, etc. or one defined by the institution to manage external products.

pricingType.description: Indicates the pricing type such as Debit,Credit

propertyName.description: Indicates the  property description to which benefit has been applied

baseValue.description: Indicates the actual value such as fees or interest applicable for an event

adjustValue.description: Indicates the value by which base value has to be adjusted due to any pricing benefits

netValue.description: Indicates the final adjusted net value. For example NetValue is  sum or difference of BaseValue and AdjustValue

packageBenefitValue.description: Indicates the total  benefit amount when packaged

packageBenefitName.description: Indicates the benefit names when packaged

totalPackageFees.description: Indicates the net pricing benefit amount  of package when pricing type is debit

totalPackageCredits.description: Indicates the net pricing benefit amount of package when pricing type is credit

netPackageSavings.description: Indicates the  total  benefit amount of the package

totalOriginalFees.description: Indicates the summation  of baseValue, adjustvalue, package benefit Value when pricing type is debit

totalFeeBenefits.description: Indicates the total  Package benefit amount  when pricing type is debit.

totalOriginalCredits.description: Indicates the summation  of baseValue, adjustvalue, package benefit Value when pricing type is credit.

totalCreditBenefits.description: Indicates the total  Package benefit amount  when pricing type is credit

netOriginalCost.description: Indicates the net original cost i.e difference of fees and credits

totalBenefits.description: Indicates the total benefit value when the contracts are not part of the package

netSavings.description: Indicates the summation of total pricing values and benefit values  when the contracts are packaged

totalPackageSavings.description: Indicates the summation between net savings and net package savings

previousPeriodTotalPackageFees.description: Indicates the net pricing benefit amount of package when pricing type is debit for the previous period statement.

previousPeriodTotalPackageCredits.description: Indicates the net pricing benefit amount of package when pricing type is credit for the previous period statement.

previousPeriodNetPackageSavings.description: Indicates the total benefit amount of the package for the previous period statement.

previousPeriodTotalOriginalFees.description: Indicates the summation of basevalue, adjustvalue, package benefit value when pricing type is debit for the previous period statement.

previousPeriodTotalFeeBenefits.description: Indicates the total package benefit amount when pricing type is debit for the previous period statement

previousPeriodTotalOriginalCredits.description: Indicates the summation of basevalue, adjustvalue, package benefit value when pricing type is credit for the previous period statement

previousPeriodTotalCreditBenefits.description: Indicates the total package benefit amount when pricing type is credit for the previous period statement

previousPeriodNetOriginalCost.description: Indicates the net original cost i.e difference of fees and credits for the previous period statement

previousPeriodTotalBenefits.description: Indicates the total benefit value when the contracts are not part of the package for the previous period statement

previousPeriodNetSavings.description: Indicates the summation of total pricing values and benefit values when the contracts are packaged for the previous period statement

previousPeriodTotalPackageSavings.description: Indicates the summation between net savings and net package savings for the previous period statement

baseDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for base details in which system reference, base contract reference, event name, effective date and other related details are defined

systemReference.description: Contains the identifier for the system in which the event originated from. For ex, ‘Hogan’ or ‘TransactAccounts’ etc

baseContractReference.description: Contains the identifier for the contract or account in which the event is raised in the core system. This would typically be a unique reference to identify the specific contract or account in the system

companyReference.description: Contains the identifier of the underlying Entity or Company or Branch

eventName.description: Indicates the name of the event that is understood by the Enterprise product pricing system.

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

channel.description: Contains the channel in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on channel, then this is not significant

branch.description: Contains the branch name/code in which the business activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on branch, then this is not significant

lineOfBusiness.description: Contains the line of business in which the activity was performed. If pricing is not determined based on line of business, then this is not significant

feeDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for fee details in which fee name, fee amount, adjsuted fee amount are defined

feeName.description: Indicates the identifier for the fee(s) associated with the event. If a fee is already computed by the core system, then that fee name could be passed here.

feeDescription.description: Indicates the description of the fee name
feeDescription.example: Fees for opening a new account.

originalFee.description: Indicates the actual fee amount applicable for the event without any pricing benefits. Pricing benefits means any fee or interest benefits applicable to the event and  pricing evaluation means fee amount or interest rate calculated based on the predefined rules applied for the contract. It will add or subtract the adjusted amount/rate to the original fee or rate based on the predefined pricing operand and the rule value

feeAdjusted.description: Indicates the total pricing benefit (adjustment amount) which is calculated during pricing evaluation. It will be total of various pricing benefits  such as customer segment pricing, relationship pricing etc.,eligible for that event

finalFee.description: Indicates the final fee after pricing evaluation. This would typically be unsigned. Pricing Evaluation means fee or interest amount calculated based on the predefined rules applied for the contract. It will add or subtract the adjusted amount to the original fee or interest amount based on the predefined pricing operand and the rule value

feeType.description: Indicates the type of fee which is applied for payment instruction whether it is credit fee type or debit fee type

feeApplicationType.description: Indicates whether the fee needs to be made Due or Pay or Capitalise. Allowed values are DUE, PAY or CAPITALISE

benefitDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for pricing benefit details in which benefit program, benefit amount and benefit type are defined. It elaborates the detailed breakup of adjustment amount

benefitProgram.description: Indicates the pricing program under which benefit was offered. Pricing benefit defines the benefits which applied for the calculated fee or interest which can be waived, adjusted or overrides their original amounts or rates

benefitAmount.description: Indicates the quantum of benefit for the benefit type. Pricing benefit defines the benefits which applied for the calculated fee or interest amount which can be waived, adjusted or overrides their original amounts

partyRole.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

partyEligibilityPass.description: Indicates whether the elibility is passed for the customer or customer role. For example, rules like customer should be local resident, customer's age should be greater than 18, etc. It will be applied on the customer while creating new contract or account. Result will be Pass or Fail

eligibilityDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for eligibility details in which rule name, rule message and rule pass are defined

ruleName.description: Name of the validation rule to be checked against an online or periodic activity.

ruleMessage.description: Indicates the failure message, if the rule applied on the customer has failed
ruleMessage.example: Customer Age should be less than 18

rulePass.description: Indicates whether the individual rule passed for the customer or customer role. Result will be Pass or FailIndicates whether the individual rule passed for the customer or customer role. Result will be Pass or Fail

productId.description: Contains the unique identifier of the product, e.g. the product id of the arrangement account.

productName.description: Product name of the bank for this account, proprietary definition.

partyDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for party details in which party id and party owner are defined

partyId.description: Allows capturing of customers or person entities to be part of the relationship. If partyType is selected as Customer, then the system will allow only customer Ids to be captured into this field. If partyType is selected as Person or Entity, then system will allow only personEntity Ids to be captured into this field.

partyRole.description: Contains the identifier used for the role played by the party or customer in the contract or account

eventDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for event details in which transaction reference, event name and effective date are defined

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

eventName.description: Indicates the name of the event that is understood by the Enterprise product pricing system.

transactionReference.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction in the pricing system

feeDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for fee details in which fee name, fee amount, adjsuted fee amount are defined

feeName.description: Indicates the identifier for the fee(s) associated with the event. If a fee is already computed by the core system, then that fee name could be passed here.

feeDescription.description: Indicates the description of the fee name

originalFee.description: Indicates the actual fee amount applicable for the event without any pricing benefits. Pricing benefits means any fee or interest benefits applicable to the event and  pricing evaluation means fee amount or interest rate calculated based on the predefined rules applied for the contract. It will add or subtract the adjusted amount/rate to the original fee or rate based on the predefined pricing operand and the rule value

feeAdjusted.description: Indicates the total pricing benefit (adjustment amount) which is calculated during pricing evaluation. It will be total of various pricing benefits  such as customer segment pricing, relationship pricing etc.,eligible for that event

finalFee.description: Indicates the final fee after pricing evaluation. This would typically be unsigned. Pricing Evaluation means fee or interest amount calculated based on the predefined rules applied for the contract. It will add or subtract the adjusted amount to the original fee or interest amount based on the predefined pricing operand and the rule value

feeType.description: Indicates the type of fee which is applied for payment instruction whether it is credit fee type or debit fee type

baseFeeAdjustment.description: Indicates the final adjusted amount for the periodic charge. Periodic charge can be calculated based on the individual fee amount and pricing benefit also applied on it if defined. Pricing benefit defines the benefits applied for the fee or interest amount calculated which can be waived, adjusted or override their original amounts

benefitDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for pricing benefit details in which benefit program, benefit amount and benefit type are defined. It elaborates the detailed breakup of adjustment amount

feeApplicationType.description: Indicates whether the fee needs to be made Due or Pay or Capitalise. Allowed values are DUE, PAY or CAPITALISE

benefitProgram.description: Indicates the pricing program under which benefit was offered. Pricing benefit defines the benefits which applied for the calculated fee or interest which can be waived, adjusted or overrides their original amounts or rates

benefitType.description: Indicates the nature of benefit. It can be adjust, override or waive

benefitAmount.description: Indicates the quantum of benefit for the benefit type. Pricing benefit defines the benefits which applied for the calculated fee or interest amount which can be waived, adjusted or overrides their original amounts

individualFeeDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for individual fee details in which base fee name, fee description, fee amount, fee adjusted and fee net amount are defined

baseFeeName.description: Indicates the individual fee name for the periodic charge

baseFeeDescription.description: Indicates the individual fee name description for the periodic charge

baseFeeAmount.description: Indicates the individual/ original fee amount defined for the periodic charge

baseFeeNetAmount.description: Indicates the final amount after adjustments are applied for the periodic charge due to pricing benefits. Pricing benefit defines the benefits applied for the fee or interest calculated which can be waived, adjusted or override their original amounts

periodStartDate.description: Indicates the date which can be used as the start date for computing the period charge

chargeCurrency.description: Contains the identifier for the currency in which charge is calculated

benefitDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for pricing benefit details in which benefit program, benefit amount and benefit type are defined. It elaborates the detailed breakup of adjustment amount

pricingProgram.description: Indicates the pricing program for which pricing benefit rule will be evaluated

pricingBenefit.description: Specifies the name of the pricing benefit

benefitType.description: Indicates the nature of benefit. It can be adjust, override or waive

benefitValue.description: Indicates the benefit value for the benefit applied. It can be amount or rate based on the definition of benefit applied

evaluationId.description: Indicates the unique reference for the evaluation results of each and every rule run through pricing rules or activity restriction

tierDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for the tier details in which tier rate, tier value and other details are defined.

tierFinalRate.description: Contains the final tier rate inclusive of all the pricing benefits. Pricing benefit defines the benefits which applied for the calculated fee or interest amount which can be waived, adjusted or overrides their original amounts.

tierSpread.description: Indicates the spread rate calculated for the tier

tierBaseRate.description: Indicates the base rate calculated for the tier

tierValue.description: Contains the threshold amount or percentage of the tier for the interest rates. Each tier is specified by defining the amount up to which the interest rate applies. There are three type of tiers such as Single, Level, and Banded.

individualFeeDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for individual fee details in which base fee name, fee description, fee amount, fee adjusted and fee net amount are defined

individualProperty.description: Indicates the individual property for which benefit has been applied

individualPricingType.description: Indicates the pricing type such as debit, credit for the individal pricing property

individualBaseValue.description: Indicates the base value for which benefit has been applied for the individal pricing property

individualAdjustValue.description: Indicates the value by which base value has to be adjusted for the individal pricing property

individualNetValue.description: Indicates the final adjusted net value for the individal pricing property. For example net value is sum or difference of base value and adjust value

individualBenefitDetails.description: Contains the pricing benefit details for individual pricing properties in which individual pricing program, individual pricing benefit, individual benefit type, individual benefit value and individual evaluation reference are all defined.

individualPricingProgram.description: Indicates the pricing program under which benefits offered for the individal pricing property. Pricing benefit defines the benefits which applied for the calculated fee or interest amount which can be waived, adjusted or overrides their original amounts

individualPricingBenefit.description: Specifies the name of the pricing benefit for the individal property

individualBenefitType.description: Indicates the nature of benefit for the individal property. It can be adjust, override or waive

individualBenefitValue.description: Indicates the total benefit amount for the individal pricing property. It can be amount or rate based on the definition of benefit applied

evaluationId.description: Indicates the unique reference for the evaluation results of each and every rule run through pricing rules or activity restriction

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

activityId.description: Id of the activity, e.g. ACCOUNTS-CAPITALISE-ACCHARGE*CARDISSUEFEE

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

currency.description: Identifies the currency. E.g. USD, GBP etc

pricingClass.description: Indicates the property class for which pricing benefit has been applied

pricingProperty.description: Indicates the property for which pricing needs to be evaluavated

pricingType.description: Indicates the pricing type such as Debit,Credit

baseValue.description: Indicates the actual value such as fees or interest applicable for an event

adjustValue.description: Indicates the value by which base value has to be adjusted due to any pricing benefits

netValue.description: Indicates the final adjusted net value. For example NetValue is  sum or difference of BaseValue and AdjustValue

minimumCharge.description: Defines the minimum charge amount that will be used to compare the system calculated charge amount. If the charge calculated is less than the minimum amount set, then based on the waive setup, either the min charge amount would be applied or it would be waived

maximumCharge.description: Indicates the maximum charge amount for the specific fee type.

applicationMethod.description: Denotes the method that needs to be applied to the rule break charges. Allowed values are Due, Defer, Capitalise. If it is set to Due then the Rule break charges are made due. If it is set to Capitalise then the Rule break charges are capitalised. If it is set to Defer then the Rule break charges are calculated but not applied immediately, charge are deferred and are collected over a period of time

tierType.description: Type of the tier rate. Allowed values: - BAND: rates apply within each band - LEVEL: a common rate applies, determined by the highest level

systemReference.description: Contains the identifier for the system in which the event originated from. For ex, ‘Hogan’ or ‘TransactAccounts’ etc

eventType.description: Event Type of the corporate action

eventPricingName.description: Indicates the identifier for the fee or interest associated with the event. If a fee or interest is already computed by the core system, then that pricing name would be passed to enterprise system

eventBaseValue.description: Indicates the base value for which benefit has been applied for an event

eventBaseValueCurrency.description: Indicates the currency of base value for which benefit has been applied for an event

eventAdjustValue.description: Indicates the value by which base value has to be adjusted for an event

adjustmentReason.description: Indicates the reason for the adjustment of amount

settleArrangement.description: Contains the pricing arrangement for an account or contract to settle the due or pay bills

settleSystemReference.description: Contains the unique identifier of the settle arrangement for the system in which the event originated from. For ex, ‘Hogan’ or ‘TransactAccounts’ etc

settleContractReference.description: Contains the unique identifier of the settle arrangement for the contract or account in which the event is raised from the core system. This would typically be a unique reference to identify the specific contract or account in the system

selectedPrograms.description: Indicates the program that is selected to receive the benefits

selectedProgram.description: Indicates the program that is selected to receive the benefits

ruleExpression.description: Indicates the rule formula that is mapped to the rule

ruleExpressionEvaluationResult.description: Indicates the evaluation result when the rule expression gets evaluavated. It can be pass or fail

ruleDetails.description: Contains the rule details such as rule name, rule expression and evaluation result.

rule.description: A rule is assigned to customer of a product and the rule determines whether a customer can buy that product or hold it after changes in circumstance

evaluationResult.description: Indicates the evaluation result when the rule expression gets evaluavated

failureAction.description: During the close of business (COB), dependent on value set and change in customer static data, an action will occur. Standard set of values are change product, close or ignore

evaluationDetails.description: Contains the evaluation details such as pricing benefit, pricing program, logical operand, evaluation, evaluation result, adjust operand, adjust amount, source details, etc.

pricingBenefit.description: Specifies the name of the pricing benefit

logicalOperand.description: Indicates whether all rule or any one of the rule should pass to qualify for the pricing benefit when multiple rules are specified.Allowed values are AND or OR

evaluation.description: This attribute defines the decision that need to be taken when a rule is passed or failed. Options available for this attribute is BREAK and SATISFY. BREAK - A defined rule has failed. SATISFY - A defined rule has passed

evaluationResult.description: Indicates the evaluation result when the rule expression gets evaluavated

adjustOperand.description: Indicates the adjustment operand whether the specified adjustment amount or adjustment percentage gets added or subtracted or multiplied to the calculated charge amount

adjustPercentage.description: Indicates the adjustment percentage by which the charge amount will be increased or decreased or multiplied based on the operand

adjustAmount.description: Indicates the adjustment amount that need to be added to or subtracted from or multiplied with the charge amount

overrideValue.description: Indicates the charge amount or interest rate which will override the actual value

sourceDetails.description: Contains the source details for the rule such as source type, source, actual value, rule value, rule result, etc.

benefitProgram.description: Indicates the pricing program under which benefit was offered. Pricing benefit defines the benefits which applied for the calculated fee or interest which can be waived, adjusted or overrides their original amounts or rates

ruleValue.description: Indicates the rule value that will be used for the evaluation of the rule

sourceType.description: Indicates source type to determine base amount. Possible values are BALANCE (base amount of a property), ACTIVITY ( transaction amount against an activity) or PROPERTY (this type is currently not supported)

source.description: Identifies the source based on which the annual percentage rate will be calculated

actualValue.description: Indicates the actual value calculated by the rule during evaluation.

actualResult.description: Indicates the evaluation result of the rule expression

It will add or subtract the adjusted amount to the original fee or interest amount based on the predefined pricing operand and the rule value

finalRate.description: Indicates the final rate applied along with any pricing benefit applied as an adjust rate due to pricing evalauation

rateApplicationType.description: Indicates whether the interest needs to be made Due or Pay or Capitalise. Allowed values are DUE, PAY or CAPITALISE

ratePricingId.description: Indicates the unique reference which will be generated for each pricing calculation which contains final fee or interest including pricing benefits

ratePricingProgram.description: Indicates the pricing program under which benefit was offered. Pricing benefit defines the benefits which applied for the calculated fee or interest which can be waived, adjusted or overrides their original amounts or rates

ratePricingBenefit.description: Specifies the name of the pricing benefit

rateBenefitType.description: Indicates the nature of benefit. It can be adjust, override or waive

rateBenefitRate.description: Contains the benefit rate of pricing benefit

arrangementId.description: Indicates an unique identifier of an account

baseDetails.description: Indicates the identifier for base details in which system reference, base contract reference, event name, effective date and other related details are defined

systemReference.description: Contains the identifier for the system in which the event originated from. For ex, ‘Hogan’ or ‘TransactAccounts’ etc

companyReference.description: Contains the identifier of the underlying Entity or Company or Branch

effectiveDate.description: Contains the identifier for the transaction date. Dates are expected in ‘YYYYMMDD’ format

adjustPricingName.description: Indicates the interest, charge and periodic charges attribute name which has to be adjusted with manual pricing

adjustValue.description: Indicates the value by which base value has to be adjusted due to any pricing benefits

adjustmentReason.description: Indicates the reason for the adjustment of amount

adjustExpirydate.description: Contains the expiry date for the adjustment

adjustType.description: Indicates the adjust type for the adjustment. It can be adjsut, waive or override

expireOnTermChanges.description: Indicates whether the adjustment to be expired or retained during reset activities. Set the value to true if adjustment need to be expired or set the value to false if adjustment need to be retained

contractReference.description: Contains the identifier for the contract or account in which the event is raised. This would typically be a unique reference to identify the specific contract/account in the system.
